result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Charles Koehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
DNA surcharge.  
Court waives all other court costs due to defendant's inability to pay .
- No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

No possession of weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Cooperate with his probation agent.
Provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 19 FOR BRANCH 17.  Defendant Andrew Charles Koehler in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Andrew Charles Koehler in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEARS at the House of Corrections with 37 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- cooperate with his probation agent
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol. No possession of drug paraphenalia
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
- no possession of weapons
- no voting until his voting rights are restored.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
DNA surcharge.  
Court waives all other court costs due to defendant's inability to pay 
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Held off the record.   Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Any motions due no later than 09-23-2015 at 8:30 am. Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 09-23-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew Charles Koehler in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Andrew Charles Koehler in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Andrew Charles Koehler not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT FILE. Return on bench warrant held. Court cancelled warrant.  Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets cash bail of $600.00.   Court adjourned case for Preliminary Hearing on 08-26-2015 at 1:30 pm, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 08-14-2015. Bench Warrant in file. Case is adjourned on 08-18-2015 at 8:30 am for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 17. Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.

Defendant Andrew Charles Koehler not in court.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
